Legal_Issue: Is Genpharm's allegation of noninfringement justified under the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations?
Evidence_Assessment: Genpharm's ticlopidine tablets do not contain any of the ten acids specified in the '170 patent; stearic acid used as a lubricant, not covered by patent claims
Burden_of_Proof: On Hoffmann-La Roche to prove infringement
Legal_Rule: Generic company must allege that no claim of the patent would be infringed by its product
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with regulatory requirements for noninfringement allegation
Grounds_for_Claim: Hoffmann-La Roche challenged Genpharm's right to market ticlopidine without infringing their patent
Review_Standard: Whether noninfringement allegation met regulatory requirements
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Regulatory process followed correctly by Genpharm
Key_Evidence_Considered: Absence of specified acids in Genpharm's product; use of stearic acid as lubricant
Applicant_Challenge: Hoffmann-La Roche challenged Genpharm's NOC application
Defendant_Response: Genpharm alleged noninfringement based on formulation differences
Evidence_Type: Product formulation data, patent claims analysis
Outcome: Remedy denied; Genpharm allowed to proceed
Decision_Authority: Federal Court or relevant judicial body
Legal_Provision: Section(s) under the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Noninfringement due to absence of patented components
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for prohibition of market entry
